org.logicmill.util.concurrent

Class ConcurrentHashMapProbe.SegmentProbe

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.logicmill.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMapProbe.SegmentProbe
  • Enclosing class:
    ConcurrentHashMapProbe

    public class ConcurrentHashMapProbe.SegmentProbe
extends java.lang.Object
    A reflection-based probe for inspecting the internal data structures of an instance of ConcurrentHashMap.Segment.
    Author:
    David Curtis

    • Method Detail

      • getBuckets

        public java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicIntegerArray getBuckets()
        Returns the buckets array for the segment. A bucket is a linked list of entries, such that the hash codes for all entries in the bucket resolve to the same bucket array index. More specifically, buckets[i] is the root of the linked list containing all entries such that 
        
 bucketIndex(entry.getHashCode()) == i
        where bucketIndex(hashCode) returns a value derived from a hash code that can be used as in index for the buckets array. The value of buckets[i] is an offset (from i) of the first entry in the bucket's list. Or,
        
 entries[(i + buckets[i]) % buckets.length]
        is the first entry in the bucket rooted at buckets[i]. Subsequent entries in the bucket (if any) are linked through the offsets array (see getOffsets()).
        Returns:
        reference to the segment's buckets array
        See Also:
        getOffsets(), getEntries()

      • getOffsets

        public java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicIntegerArray getOffsets()
        Returns the offsets array for the segment. In conjunction with the buckets array (see getBuckets()), offsets describes links in the bucket linked-list structure. Given a bucket rooted at buckets[i], the first entry is located at
        
 entries[i0] : i0 = (i + buckets[i]) % buckets.length
        offsets[i0] contains either NULL_OFFSET, indicating the end of the list, or a link (as an offset from i) to the second entry in the bucket at
        
 entries[i1] : i1 = (i + offsets[i0]) % buckets.length
        and subsesquent entries are at
        
 entries[ij] : ij = (i + offsets[ij-1]) % buckets.length
        until the list is terminated by a NULL_OFFSET value (-1) in offsets[ij].
        Returns:
        reference to the segment's offsets array

      • getTimeStamps

        public java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicIntegerArray getTimeStamps()
        Returns the timeStamps array for the segment. Time stamp values are used by retrieval operations (get and iterator operations) to detect concurrent bucket updates that may invalidate the retrieval results. Each element timeStamps[i] corresponds the bucket at the same index, buckets[i]. Update operations that alter bucket structure increment the bucket's time stamp at critical serialization points. Retrieval operations compare time stamp values before and after traversing a bucket, and re-try the operation if the time stamp changed during traversal.
        Returns:
        reference to the segment's timeStamps array

      • getEntries

        public java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReferenceArray<java.util.Map.Entry<?,?>> getEntries()
        Returns the entries array for the segment.
        Returns:
        reference to the segment's entries array

      • getIndexMask

        public int getIndexMask()
        Returns the segment's indexMask value. The indexMask value is used to perform the equivalent of a modulus operation on hash codes, with the divisor segmentSize (which is the length of the various arrays in the segment -- buckets, entries, and so on. indexMask = segmentSize - 1, where segmentSize is an integral power of 2. The modulus operation devolves to a bitwise AND operation.
        Returns:
        segment's indexMask value

      • getLocalDepth

        public int getLocalDepth()
        Returns the local depth of the segment. The value of localDepth corresponds the number of bits in hash code values (at the least-significant end of the hash code} that are common for all entries in the segment. These bits are discarded when deriving a bucket index from a hash code value. Specifically,
        
 int bucketIndex(int hashCode) { return (hashCode >>> localDepth) & indexMask; }
        Returns:
        the local depth of the segment
        See Also:
        getIndexMask()

      • getSharedBits

        public int getSharedBits()
        The shared bit pattern for all entries in the segment. The least significant localDepth bits for all entries in the segment should have the same value, that being sharedBits.
        Returns:
        the shared bit pattern for the segment
        See Also:
        getLocalDepth()

      • getSerialID

        public int getSerialID()
        Returns the serial ID number of the segment. Each segment has a unique serial ID number. The extendible hashing algorithm allows that multiple directory indices may refer to the same segment. Segment serial ID numbers provide a means for programs traversing the directory to determine whether a segment has already been seen or not.
        Returns:
        the serial ID number of the segment

      • getSharedBitsMask

        public int getSharedBitsMask()
        Returns a mask corresponding the bits in a hash code that contain the shared bit pattern for the segment. Specifically,
        
        int sharedBitsMask = (1L << localDepth) - 1;
        and for all entries in the segment,
        
        (entry.getHashCode() & getSharedBitsMask()) == getSharedBits()
        Returns:
        the shared bits mask value for the segment
        See Also:
        getSharedBitsMask(), getLocalDepth()

      • getSegmentLock

        public java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock getSegmentLock()
        Returns the mutual update exclusion lock for the segment. Certain validation operations may require excluding updates from a segment. Should be used with care.
        Returns:
        update lock for segment

      • getEntryCount

        public int getEntryCount()
                  throws ConcurrentHashMapProbe.ProbeInternalException
        Returns the number of entries in the segment.
        Returns:
        number of entries in the segment
        Throws:
        ConcurrentHashMapProbe.ProbeInternalException

      • wrapIndex

        public int wrapIndex(int unwrappedIndex)
        Returns a calculated index modulus the segment array size
        Parameters:
        unwrappedIndex - the calculated index
        Returns:
        index modulus segment size

      • bucketIndex

        public int bucketIndex(int hashCode)
        Returns the bucket index derived from a hash code value:
        
 return (hashCode >>> getLocalDepth()) & getIndexMask();
        Parameters:
        hashCode - hash code value used to derive bucket index
        Returns:
        the index of bucket (in the buckets array corresponding to hashCode

      • isBucketEmpty

        public boolean isBucketEmpty(int bucketIndex)
        Returns true if the bucket at bucketIndex is empty, that is, if buckets[bucketIndex] == NULL_OFFSET.
        Parameters:
        bucketIndex -
        Returns:
        true if the bucket at bucketIndex is empty

      • getEntryHashCode

        public int getEntryHashCode(java.util.Map.Entry<?,?> entry)
        Returns the hash code for the specified entry.
        Parameters:
        entry - entry of which the hash code is returned
        Returns:
        hash code for entry

      • getMapProbe

        public ConcurrentHashMapProbe getMapProbe()
        Returns the map probe object to which this segment probe belongs.
        Returns:
        reference to the map probe object for this segment probe

      • getBucketMap

        public long getBucketMap(int bucketIndex)
        Returns a long value containing set bits that correspond to entries in the specified bucket, where the bit position corresponds to the offset of the entry from the bucket index. Specifically, if ((result & (1 << n)) != 0) then buckets[bucketIndex] contains an entry at offset n. Valid bits are 2n where for n in (0 .. HOP_RANGE - 1). HOP_RANGE cannot exceed 64 without re-designing this method, but that seems unlikely.
        Parameters:
        bucketIndex - index of the bucket whose map is returned
        Returns:
        the bitwise map of entries in the specified bucket

      • bucketContainsEntry

        public boolean bucketContainsEntry(int bucketIndex,
                          java.util.Map.Entry<?,?> entry)
        Returns true if the bucket at bucketIndex contains the specified entry. This method traverses the bucket linked list to determine the result, as opposed to simply comparing bucketIndex(getEntryHashCode(entry)) with bucketIndex.
        Parameters:
        bucketIndex - index of the bucket in which entry may be present
        entry - entry whose presence in the bucket is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the specified entry is in the specified bucket
